description: What is the general idea of the text?

options.label: A
options.description: It' s safe to arrive late just when food is served.

options.label: B
options.description: It' s wise to eat something before going to a party.

options.label: C
options.description: It' s important to follow social rules of party-going.

options.label: D
options.description: It' s necessary to read invitations carefully.

description: According to the writer, people in their late thirties_______.

options.label: A
options.description: are likely to arrive late for a party

options.label: B
options.description: care little about the party time

options.label: C
options.description: haven' t really grown up yet

description: For some young people, arriving on time for a students' party will probably be considered_______.
Jane and David' s story is used to show that______ .

options.label: A
options.description: party-goers usually get hungry at parties

options.label: C
options.description: people should ask for food at parties

options.label: D
options.description: birthday parties for middle-aged people are dull

description: Which is true according to the passage?

options.label: A
options.description: Chinese Taibei recognizes diplomas earned on the Chinese mainland

options.label: B
options.description: The number of Taiwanese students going to study on the mainland will surely be increasing in the next few years.

options.label: C
options.description: Chinese Taibei doesn’t help with any inquiries about Taiwanese studying in the mainland

options.label: D
options.description: Education of Taiwan is far behind the mainland.

description: The author wrote the article to tell us ______________.

options.label: A
options.description: more Taiwanese students are studying on the mainland.

options.label: B
options.description: the number of Taiwanese students going to universities on the mainland had been increasing year after year

options.label: C
options.description: education on the mainland is more attractive compared with that of Taiwan

options.label: D
options.description: Taiwan and the mainland should cooperate with each other in every field.

description: The underlined word “it” in the third paragraph refers to __________.

options.label: B
options.description: a Chinese education on the mainland

description: Some business executives were sending their children to study in the Chinese mainland so that their children ___________.

options.label: B
options.description: could learn more about the policy there

options.label: C
options.description: could do well in the business operations

description: The teacher was much kinder to those who work harder than to the others, ___ of course, made the others envy them.

___, his idea was accepted by all the people at the meeting.

I don’t mind her criticizing me, but ___ is how she does it that I object to.
Daddy didn’t mind what we were doing as long as we were together ___ fun.

It appears that the writer tends to think highly of the person who sleeps on one side because ________________.

options.label: A
options.description: he or she always shows sympathy for people

options.label: B
options.description: he or she is confident,but not stubborn

options.label: C
options.description: he or she has more strengths than weaknesses

options.label: D
options.description: he or she often considers annoying people

description: Maybe you don’t want to make friends with a person who sleeps curled up.Why?

options.label: A
options.description: He or she would rather be alone than communicate with you.

options.label: B
options.description: He or she is rarely ready to help you.

options.label: C
options.description: He or she prefers staying at home to going out.

options.label: D

description:
Point out which sentence is used to show the personality of a person who is used to sleeping

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.description: He or she can't be successful in any business.

options.label: D
options.description: He or she likes to bring others happiness.

description: Which is NOT mentioned in the second paragraph about a person's personality?

options.label: A
options.description: He or she is always open with others.

options.label: B
options.description: He or she always likes new ideas earlier than others.

options.label: C
options.description: He or she is always easily upset.

options.label: D
